channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What does the CIA not want you to know? The quiz has the secret
item.description: Plus: ambiguous mascots, rodents with hard-to-spell names, and three boring photos of buildings.

item.title: Dog sled, ski ballet and other sports you could once see at the Winter Olympics
item.description: For many decades, Olympic Games included "demonstration sports." Some, like curling, became part of the permanent roster. But others, like skijoring, ...

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s demand for mom’s ‘proof of life’ is complicated in this era of AI and deepfakes
Fear in Minnesota’s Somali community deepens, hampering progress on measles vaccination
Sapiom raises $15M to help AI agents buy their own tech tools
item.description: The startup -- with backing from Accel -- is building a financial layer that handles the authentication and micro-payments required for AI agents.

item.title: AWS revenue continues to soar as cloud demand remains high
item.description: AWS recorded its best quarter, in terms of revenue growth, in 13 quarters in Q4 2025 as AI drives AWS adoption.

item.title: Amazon and Google are winning the AI capex race — but what’s the prize?
item.description: In 2026, Amazon plans to spend $200 billion in capex. Google is just behind at $175 billion to $185 billion. It's a lot of money!

item.title: The Washington Post is retreating from Silicon Valley when it matters most
item.description: The Bezos-owned newspaper gutted its San Francisco bureau and coverage of tech — including journalists reporting on Amazon and Blue Origin.

item.title: Reddit looks to AI search as its next big opportunity

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s family renews plea to mother’s kidnapper, while sheriff says they have no suspect
item.description: The family of “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie is renewing their plea for their mother’s kidnapper to contact them.
